span.a: You are currently on this page - COVID-19 Closure - Updates & Resources

h1.span: Milton Schools Will Be Closed for the Duration of the Health Emergency.

p.span: For full details please read Governor Evers' Emergency Order #12: "Safer at Home"

h1.span: During the Closure, District Updates Will Be Posted Every Friday

div.p: Click Image Below to Read the Latest Edition

p.span: For those who may need additional support during the closure, please consider taking this optional survey.(This brief survey will ask about your family's access to the internet, food, etc.)

p.strong: For a more detailed list of available resources and for student services staff contact information, please refer to our Family Resources Guide.

span.big: Breakfast / Lunch for Students During Closure

span.span: During the mandated school closure, the School District of Milton will provide free meals to all children 18 and under. This program will begin March 30th and will run every week, Monday through Friday, until the health emergency ends.

big.b: To help assist with the amount of meals needed at each location, please fill out and submit this School Lunch Sign Up This is not necessary but would be helpful to the Nutrition team.

span.span: Meals can be picked up at the following locations:
Those with food allergies should connect with the nutrition team ahead of pick up. Please use the Google Sign Up form, or call Verlene Orr at 608-868-9561
This is open to ALL children, not just Milton students.

big.b: This program is solely for the pick-up of meals; Meals must not be consumed on site!

span.span: To maintain social distancing, families are asked not to congregate at the pick-up locations. Please stay in your car and wait to drive up.
Meals will be available while supplies last.

big.b: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

p.span: On March 24, 2020, Governor Evers issued Emergency Order #12: "Safer at Home,"

all non-essential travel with specific exceptions. This order will continue until at least Friday, April 24, 2020. This order does allow for school districts to continue to operate, including virtual learning and providing meals, but it restricts non-essential travel. School districts have some leeway to determine what we consider essential travel for the services we provide.
The district urges everyone to carefully consider any and all travel plans they may have in the upcoming days and weeks. There is confirmed community spread of COVID-19 in our area.
Please review travel advisories and/or travel considerations recommended by the Rock County Health Department (AVAILABLE HERE) and the CDC (AVAILABLE HERE) before your departure.

td.p: The SDM admin team has been working closely with local health departments to determine the best possible courses of action going forward. Members of the School Safety Team have worked to update the district's original pandemic plan in preparation of a potential outbreak of COVID-19 in our region. Please know, the district will take its cues from the Rock County Department of Public Health, the Wisconsin Public Health Department and the US Center for Disease Control in all potential decisions on closures and cancellations.
The Website Version of SDM's pandemic plan is available HERE
